thread.title: Katy Perry Channels the Suffragists at the Grammys, Dances in Front of the Constitution
thread.title_full: Katy Perry Channels the Suffragists at the Grammys, Dances in Front of the Constitution

title: Katy Perry Channels the Suffragists at the Grammys, Dances in Front of the Constitution
text:
By Mattie Kahn Feb 12, 2017 Katy Perry delivered one of the most political moments at the Grammys this evening, performing her new semi-political single "Chained to the Rhythm" in a white pantsuit and an armband emblazoned with a battle cry—"Persist." One of Hillary Clinton's most vocal supporters during the election, Perry seemed to dress with a few special women in mind—not only Clinton, but the suffragists, who were known to march in white. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Omg @katyperry in a white #pantsuit and a #persist arm band. SOS I THINK I'M IN LOVE. pic.twitter.com/WnB7q7kesR 
— Emily DaSilva (@emdasilva) February 13, 2017 Most Popular Perry and Skip Marley, who's featured on the track, wrapped up the set in front of a super-sized photo of the Constitution, which every single American citizen, the President of the United States, included, should probably take a few minutes to review. Getty
